sen.j: ICOCA（イコカ）は、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）が2003年11月1日に近畿地方のアーバンネットワークで最初に導入した、主に乗車カードや電子マネー、ロッカーの鍵として利用できるICカードである。
sen.e: ICOCA (ikoka) is a IC card, mainly used as a ticket, electronic money, and a locker key, which West Japan Railway Company (JR West) introduced for the first time in the Kinki District Urban Network on November 1, 2003.
sen.cmt: 西日本旅客鉄道（JR West)→West Japan Railway Company (JR West)
sen.e: ICOCA (ikoka) is a IC card, mainly used as a ticket, electronic money and a locker key, which West Japan Railway Company (JR West) launched for the first time in the Kinki District Urban Network on November 1, 2003.
ICOCA (ikoka) is an IC card, mainly used as a ticket, electronic money and locker key, that West Japan Railway Company (JR West) launched in the Kinki District Urban Network on November 1, 2003.

sen.j: また、JR西日本の登録商標でもある。
sen.e: It is also a registered trademark owned by JR West.
It is also a registered trademark owned by JR West.
It is also a registered trademark owned by JR West.

sen.j: ソニーの非接触型ICカードFeliCaの技術を用いている。
sen.e: The card uses the technology of Sony's Contactless IC smart card, FeLiCa.
sen.cmt: 非接触型ICカード→Contactless IC smart card （英辞郎on the WRB）
sen.e: The card uses the technology of Sony's Contactless IC smart card, FeLiCa.
The card uses the technology of Sony's Contactless IC smart card, FeLiCa.

sen.j: ストアードフェアシステムのJスルーのICカード版で、さらに定期乗車券と電子マネーの機能を併せ持つカードである。
sen.e: This is a IC card version of J-Thru, a stored fare (SF) system card, and in addition, the functions of ticket and electronic money are incorporated.

sen.e: This is a IC card version of J-Thru, a stored fare (SF) system card, and in addition the functions of ticketing and electronic money are incorporated.

sen.j: ICオペレーティングカード（IC Operating CArd）の略称だが、関西弁の「行こか」（「行こう」の意味）とも掛けた、親しみやすい名称としている。
sen.e: The name (ICOCA) derives from the abbreviation of IC Operating CArd, but at the same it is a play on words with an expression "Ikoka" meaning "Let's go" in Kansai accent in order to make the name more friendly and catchy.

The name (ICOCA) derives from the abbreviation of IC Operating CArd, but at the same time it's a play on words with the expression "Ikoka" meaning "Let's go" in Kansai accent, in order to make the name more friendly and catchy.

sen.j: 2003年11月1日から近畿地方のアーバンネットワークで使用が開始された。
sen.e: The card started to be used form November 1, 2003 in the Kinki District Urban Network.
The card went into use on November 1, 2003 in the Kinki District Urban Network.

Currently, the card can also be used in the following areas: all private and subway lines and some parts of bus lines (PiTaPa area) in the Keihanshin area; the Suica area such as East Japan Railway (JR East); and the TOICA area covered by Central Japan Railway (JR Central).

sen.j: 非接触型のICカードで、パスケースに入れたまま自動改札機に軽くタッチするだけで改札を入・出場することができ、通るたびにその都度パスケースから取り出す必要がない。
sen.e: As the card is contactless IC card, you may swish through the automatic ticket checker, just touching it lightly with the card tacked inside the pass case and it is not necessary to take the card out of the case every time you go through the checker.

Because the card is a contactless IC type, you can swish through the automatic ticket checker simply by touching it lightly with the card tacked inside the pass case; it isn't necessary to take the card out of the case each time you go through the checker.

sen.j: ただし、ICOCAと改札機との通信を確実に行わせるため、パスケースなどを改札機に触れさせる目的で、関西では「タッチしていこか」というフレーズで浸透させている。
sen.e: However, to secure the data communication between the ICOCA card and the ticket checker, there is a campaign to extend the practice of taking the card out of the case and touching the checker directly with the card, with the playing-word phrase, "Tacchishite Ikokoa (Shall we go touching with ICOCA)."

sen.e: Since PiTaPa was introduced in Nankai Electric Railway on July 1, 2007, and in Kintetsu Railway on April 1, 2007, at the stations of both companies, you can transfer passing through the transfer gate, just making one touch on the automatic ticket checker with your ICOCA card, and in case of PiTaPa as far as your card is previously recharged.

sen.e: Since PiTaPa was introduced in the Nankai Electric Railway on July 1, 2007, and in the Kintetsu Railway on April 1, 2007, at the stations of both companies you can transfer by passing through the transfer gate, making one touch on the automatic ticket checker with your ICOCA card or, in the case of PiTaPa, as far as your card has previously been recharged.

Since PiTaPa was introduced in the Nankai Electric Railway on July 1, 2006, and in the Kintetsu Railway on April 1, 2007, at the stations of both companies you can transfer by passing through the transfer gate, making one touch on the automatic ticket checker with your ICOCA card or, in the case of PiTaPa, as far as your card has previously been recharged.

sen.j: ただし、乗り換え改札口では相互利用できるICカードの2枚タッチができないため、JRにはICOCAやSuica、TOICAを、南海や近鉄にはPiTaPaを、と使い分けたい場合は、一旦通常の改札口を出場の上、改めて乗り換え先の通常の改札口から入場しなければならない。
sen.e: However, at the transfer gates, the combined use of two IC cards is not accepted even when they are interoperable, if you want use different cards, for example, ICOCA, Suica or TOICA for transferring to the JR Line, and PiTaPa for Nankai Electric Railway or Kintetsu Railway, you should go out through the normal ticket gate and again go in through the normal ticket gate for the line you want to transfer.

However, at the transfer gates the combined use of two IC cards is not accepted even when they're interoperable; but if you want use different cards, for example, ICOCA, Suica or TOICA for transfer to the JR Line, and PiTaPa for Nankai Electric Railway or Kintetsu Railway, you should go out through the normal ticket gate and then go in through the normal ticket gate for the line to which you want to transfer.

However, at the transfer gates the combined use of two IC cards is not accepted even when they're interoperable; therefore, if you want use different cards such as ICOCA, Suica or TOICA for transfer to the JR Line, or use PiTaPa for Nankai Electric Railway or Kintetsu Railway, you should go out through the normal ticket gate and then go in through the normal ticket gate for the line to which you want to transfer.

sen.j: なお、相互利用している交通事業者のうち、近鉄はICOCAとPiTaPaの利用が可能である（SuicaやTOICAの相互利用は行っていない）が、近鉄名古屋線の近鉄名古屋駅のJR東海との乗り換え改札口では、ICOCAまたはPiTaPaとTOICAのうち2枚を組み合わせれば、2枚重ねてタッチすることで乗り換えができる（SuicaとPiTaPaの組み合わせなど、一部に利用ができない組み合わせがある）。
sen.e: Among the railway companies that conclude the reciprocal usage agreement, Kintetsu Railway accepts only ICOCA and PiTapa (it does not practice the interoperation with Suica and TOICA), however, at the transfer gate for the JR Central railway service at Kintetsu Nagoya Station on the Kintetsu Nagoya Line, you can transfer by touching two of the three cards of ICOCA, PiTaPa and TOICA on top of one another (in some cases, a combination of Suica and PiTaPa does not work well).

Among the railway companies that conclude the reciprocal usage agreement, Kintetsu Railway accepts only ICOCA and Itapúa (it does not practice interoperation with Suica and TOICA); however, at the transfer gate for the JR Central Railway service at Kintetsu Nagoya Station on the Kintetsu Nagoya Line, you can transfer by touching two of the three cards of ICOCA, PiTaPa and TOICA on top of one another (but in some cases, a combination of Suica and PiTaPa does not work well).

sen.j: 1枚のICOCAで分割定期券とすることも可能である。
sen.e: One ICOCA card can be used for a divided-section commuter pass.
sen.cmt: 分割定期→定訳不明：divided-section commuter pass
sen.e: One ICOCA card can be used for a divided-section commuter pass.
One ICOCA card can be used for a divided-section commuter pass.

sen.j: 例えば、生瀬～大阪間の定期券を宝塚で分割購入した場合、ICOCA定期券の券面には「生瀬←→宝塚｜宝塚←→大阪」と表示される。
sen.e: For example, if you purchase the commuter pass between Namase Station and Osaka Station at Takarazuka, on the surface of the ICOCA commuter pass the two sections are printed as "Namase Station←→Takarazuka Station/ Takarazuka Station←→Osaka Station."

For example, if you purchase the commuter pass between Namase Station and Osaka Station at Takarazuka, on the surface of the ICOCA commuter pass the two sections are printed as "Namase Station←→Takarazuka Station/ Takarazuka Station←→Osaka Station."

For example, if you purchase a commuter pass between Namase Station and Osaka Station at Takarazuka, on the surface of the ICOCA commuter pass the two sections are printed as 'Namase Station↔Takarazuka Station/ Takarazuka Station↔Osaka Station.'
sen.cmt: 「←→」の表記変更NR: As it is clear from the sentence that we are talking about what actually appears on the ticket, the use of arrows as is should be fine. If, however, a right-left arrow is what actually appears on the ticket, it's probably best to use the actual symbol for a right-left arrow (see cell to left) than to use a left arrow and then a right arrow. If two separate arrows are used then please go back to using "←→".

sen.j: 相互利用しているPiTaPaはポストペイ方式のため、アーバンネットワーク内で利用する場合は、自動券売機などであらかじめチャージしておく必要が生じる。
sen.e: Since the interoperable PiTaPa card is a post-paid system, before using it in the Urban Network Area. it is necessary to recharge it by an automated ticket vending machine, etc.
Because the interoperable PiTaPa card is a post-paid system, before using it in the Urban Network Area it's necessary to recharge it via an automated ticket vending machine, etc.
Because the interoperable PiTaPa card is a post-paid system, before using it in the Urban Network Area it's necessary to recharge it via an automated ticket vending machine, etc.

sen.e: When one of the family that has PiTaPa Family Membership uses its Kid's Card in JR West Area, the users can enjoy the same functions as a holder of ICOCA for Children, and when he/she uses its Junior Card, the same function as an adult holder of ICOCA.

sen.e: Therefore, when you transfer from the Tozai Line of Tokyo Metro to another JR East line at Nishifunabashi Station, you can not go through the automatic transfer ticket checker with ICOCA.

sen.j: Suicaエリアの乗・降車駅名の履歴表示・印字は「（JR東）」「（東モノ）」「（東臨）」「（埼新）」「（仙空）」などと表示されるため、駅名を含む詳細な履歴が必要な場合はSuicaエリア内で表示・印字することになる。
sen.e: As the record of the usage made in the Suica area is displayed or printed on the card in a abbreviated manner such as「（JR東）」 or JR-East, 「（東臨）」or Tky-Mono., 「（東臨）」or Tkyo-WF. sen.e: However, from the beginning of the interoperation with PiTaPa to March 18, 2007, the usage records of the PiTiPa area were only indicated and printed on the card with an abbreviated name of the company, like "Han-kyu" "Kei-han" "O-shi-kou" or "Han-shin," and if you needed the details you had to use a machine in the PiTiPa area to get the record indicated and printed.

sen.j: ICOCAを用いた犯罪
sen.e: Crimes using ICOCA
Crimes using ICOCA
Crimes using ICOCA

sen.j: JR西日本の駅員59名と委託社員10名が、ICOCAで乗車した後、窓口の処理機で乗車記録を消去するという手段で不正乗車（キセルに類似した行為）を繰り返したとする不祥事があり、その行為はサービスが開始された2003年11月から2004年8月まで行われていたとされる。
sen.e: There was an scandal, in which 59 station employees and 10 temporary workers of JR West, who once took a train using their ICOCA card, erased the riding record of the card using the ticket processors installed in the wickets and repeatedly practiced the illegal ride (similar act to stealing a ride), and it is said that they had committed this act since November 2003 when the service was just introduced till August 2004.

There was a scandal in which 59 station employees and 10 temporary workers of JR West, who once took a train using their ICOCA card, erased the riding record of the card using the ticket processors installed in the wickets and repeatedly practiced illegal riding (an act akin to stealing a ride), and it is said that they had committed this act since November 2003, when the service was just introduced, till August 2004.

There was a scandal in which 59 station employees and 10 temporary workers of JR West, who once took a train using their ICOCA card, erased the riding record of the card using the ticket processors installed in the wickets and repeatedly practiced illegal riding (an act akin to stealing a ride), and it is said that they had committed this act since November 2003, when the service was just introduced, till August 2004.

sen.j: 不正利用の総額は104,630円に上った。
sen.e: The illegal use reached 104,630yen in total.
The illegal use amounted to a total of 104,630 yen.
The illegal use amounted to a total of 104,630 yen.

sen.j: このうち駅員10名と委託社員5名の計15名は懲戒解雇となった。
sen.e: Among these manipulators, a total of 15 persons, 10 station employees and 5 temporary workers, were dismissed on disciplinary grounds.
sen.cmt: 懲戒解雇→dismissed on disciplinary grounds（小学館プログレッシブ、英辞郎 on the WEB参照)

sen.j: 2003年6月28日～7月26日 - ICOCAモニターテストがJR神戸線大阪～芦屋間・福知山線大阪～宝塚間・JR京都線大阪～高槻間の22駅に於いて1,000名限定で開始。
